position.marginalia_text: Vir non est, qui non est vir omnium horarum; et apud omnes homines vir, quantoscu[m]q[ue] magnates; aut principes.

marginalia.translation: A man who is not a man for all hours is not a man: and a man among all men, however great magnates or princes.

position.marginalia_text: Quid prosunt omnes artes, aut omnia Ornamenta, nisi viro? Nihil habet, qui habet omnia, nisi seipsum habeat.

marginalia.translation: What is the usefulness of all arts, or all ornament, if not for a man? He who has everything, has nothing, unless he has himself.

position.marginalia_text: Plus adhuc scientia[e] in esse: plus, plusq[ue] facultatis. Ante omnia, et super Singula; Summa[e] Mnemonica[e].

marginalia.translation: So far more knowledge in being: more and more skill. Before all things, and above singular things: the greatest remembrances.

position.marginalia_text: aut actionum, huic repugnet scopo. Nuga[e], omnia mundi optata, pra[e] meo vnius pra[e]stantissimo scopo. Intima omniu[m] scientiarum practica percallere;
eademq[ue] in mundo acerrimè extendere: nihil vanum, aut inefficax ad mittere: mera operandi, negociandiq[ue] puncta prosequi: mea adhuc solius industria.

marginalia.translation: To have all arts, philosophies, and professions: in the end, the highest mysteria and stratagem is my singular profession. And my unique goal, affectionate of praxis, is to be able to do the majority of all things in the world. No other pursuits or actions disagree with this goal. Trifles, all desires of the world, for my most outstanding goal of one thing. To thoroughly understand the inimate practices of all sciences; and to extend these practices vigorously in the world: to put forward nothing vain or ineffective. To follow the pure points of acting and doing business: my industriousness is still the only thing.
